chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Manuel Ramos Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 12.14.15 and be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12.14.15 and be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO CASE ENDING 3277, with credit for 75 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: NO CONTACT ORDER WITH THE VICTIM REMAINS.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation and register as a sex offender.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 AND CONSECUTIVE TO CASE ENDING 3277.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO CASE ENDING 3277, with credit for 75 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 AND CONSECUTIVE TO CASE ENDING 3277,  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

NO CONTACT ORDER WITH THE VICTIM REMAINS.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation and register as a sex offender.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 12.14.15 and be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12.14.15 and be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
received and filed.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(2)(a), a Felony.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 27, 2015 @ 8:30am Received and Filed

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Victor Manuel Ramos not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and a plea hearing in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-27-2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Final Pre-Trial on August 13, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed. Copies given to the Sheriff's Department, ADA Karshen, and attorney Lin. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Arguments heard as to the State's motion to rescind the defendant's communication privileges. Court GRANTED the State's request and signed the proposed order. Defendant may have communications with his attorney. All other conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
NO FILE IN COURT. Case set for bail hearing. Arguments heard as to the State's motion to consolidate with defendant's other pending case 14CF3277. Court DENIED the State's motion for reasons stated on the record. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 8/13/15 and for jury trial on 8/31/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's Motion to Consolidate Cases for Trial received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Rescind the Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Privileges with attached proposed order received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

ADA Karshen contacted the Court requesting a bail hearing be scheduled. Defense counsel notified. Case adjourned to 6/25/15 at 8:30 a.m. for a Bail/Bond Hearing in Branch 25. Clerk notified Sheriff's Department to have the defendant produced. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense no longer wished to proceed with plea, and requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. State placed negotiations on the record.   Parties to file motions by 06/17/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of 8/01/2015 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Victor Manuel Ramos not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived the defendants appearance for today's proceedings. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

State requested the No contact order be modified to reflect an AKA of G. Ramos for GL (female) listed on the original no contact order. Court granted State's request. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Louis Epps on behalf of Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel has not received discovery from the State and requests an adjourned scheduling date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Ronald Dague for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
N0 ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CMC, SL,GL (MALE), GL (FEMALE).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Victor Manuel Ramos in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
